DataElement.preferredName: Patient Bilateral Breast Carcinoma Hormone Level Inclusion Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to whether or not the hormonal status reported applies to bilateral breast cancer

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Bilateral Breast Carcinoma Hormone Level Inclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the hormone levels reported for bilateral breast cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Concepts.definition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.

Property.preferredName: Bilateral Breast Carcinoma Hormone Level Inclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Carcinoma that affects both breasts in a simultaneous or non-simultaneous manner.:Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects.:A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.:Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered.

Concepts.definition: Carcinoma that affects both breasts in a simultaneous or non-simultaneous manner.

Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

Medical and/or social characteristics which are necessary for a subject to be allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. Meeting inclusion criteria is not a sufficient condition for entry or recruitment of a subject into the study. Characteristics limiting the eligibility of a subject for the clinical study must be considered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Do all HER2 and hormonal stat
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do all HER2 and hormonal statuses previously reported apply to both left and right primary breast cancers

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has bilateral invasive breast cancers, are both HER2-positive as defined in the protocol, have at least one that meets all protocol eligibility criteria, and is such that neither cancer renders the patient ineligible?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has bilateral invasive breast cancers, are both HER2-positive as defined in the protocol, does at least one meet all protocol eligibility criteria, and do neither cancer render the patient ineligible?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2/9/23 AQT added per EA request. BF;
